metatags.twitter:title: Fact check: Image of boy sleeping between two graves was staged, not from Yemeni civil war
metatags.og:title: Fact check: Image of boy sleeping between two graves was staged, not from Yemeni civil war
metatags.og:description: A viral image online showing a boy sleeping between two graves was not captured in Yemen, where civil war persists. It instead shows a staged scene.
metatags.twitter:creator: @usatoday
metatags.article:author: Emiliano Tahui Gómez
metatags.twitter:description: A viral image online showing a boy sleeping between two graves was not captured in Yemen, where civil war persists. It instead shows a staged scene.

title: WIDER IMAGE The man who saves forgotten cats in Fukushima's ...
htmlTitle: WIDER IMAGE The man who saves forgotten cats in Fukushima's ...
snippet: Mar 3, 2021 ... Kato leaves food for feral cats in a storage shed he heats with a paraffin stove. He has also rescued a dog, Pochi. With no running water, he ...
htmlSnippet: Mar 3, 2021 ... Kato leaves food for feral cats in a storage shed he heats with a paraffin stove. He has also rescued a dog, Pochi. With no running water, he ...

metatags.og:description: A decade ago, Sakae Kato stayed behind to rescue cats abandoned by neighbours who fled the radiation clouds belching from the nearby Fukushima nuclear plant. He won't leave.
metatags.twitter:creator: @Reuters
metatags.twitter:image:alt: Cats that were rescued by Sakae Kato, rest in a cage at Kato's home, in a restricted zone in Namie, Fukushima Prefecture, Japan, February 20, 2021. Kato looks after 41 cats in his home and another empty building on his property. A decade ago, he stayed behind to rescue cats abandoned by neighbours who fled the radiation clouds belching from the nearby Fukushima nuclear plant. He won't leave. "I want to make sure I am here to take care of the last one," Kato said. "After that I want to die, whether that be a day or hour later." REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon
metatags.og:image:alt: Cats that were rescued by Sakae Kato, rest in a cage at Kato's home, in a restricted zone in Namie, Fukushima Prefecture, Japan, February 20, 2021. A decade ago, he stayed behind to rescue cats abandoned by neighbours who fled the radiation clouds belching from the nearby Fukushima nuclear plant. He won't leave. "I want to make sure I am here to take care of the last one," Kato said. "After that I want to die, whether that be a day or hour later." REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon

title: DNA tests show Bulgarian couple are parents of girl found in Greece
htmlTitle: DNA tests show Bulgarian couple are parents of girl found in Greece
snippet: Oct 25, 2013 ... DNA tests showed the Roma couple she was with were not her biological parents. ... parents of nine other children aged between two and 20, ...
htmlSnippet: Oct 25, 2013 ... DNA tests showed the Roma couple she was with were not her biological parents. ... parents of nine other children aged between two and 20, ...

metatags.og:description: By Tsvetelia Tsolova and Angel Krasimirov SOFIA (Reuters) - A Bulgarian Roma couple are the biological parents of a four-year-old blonde girl found in Greece last week, DNA tests showed on Friday, clearing some of the mystery around a case that has captured global attention. Bulgarian prosecutors are investigating whether the mother, Sasha Ruseva, 35, sold her child. Ruseva denies this, but admits leaving a seven-month-old baby in Greece - where she was working as an olive-picker - in 2009 because she could not look after the child and had to return to Bulgaria. ...
metatags.news_keywords: Sasha Ruseva, Bulgarian Roma, DNA tests, biological parents
metatags.twitter:title: DNA tests show Bulgarian couple are parents of girl found in Greece
metatags.og:title: DNA tests show Bulgarian couple are parents of girl found in Greece
